channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: New Jersey to consider charging oil and gas producers fees to fight climate change
item.description: The proposal aims to create a Climate Superfund similar to those created by the federal government to clean up toxic waste.

item.title: Political turmoil and eurozone gloom suggest third ECB rate cut incoming
item.description: The European Central Bank will seek a careful balance with its latest cut, wary of inflation, politics, and trade turbulence.

item.title: What I Learned From a Reclusive Taliban Commander
item.description: Mullah Osman Jawhari led one of the deadliest assaults on American forces in Afghanistan, a battle that came to symbolize the war itself.

item.title: New Jersey bill targeting plastic packaging would require it to be recyclable or compostable by 2034
item.description: From bubble wrap to puffy air-filled plastic pockets, lots of what keeps items safe during shipping often ends up in landfills.

item.title: What I Learned From a Reclusive Taliban Commander
item.description: Mullah Osman Jawhari led one of the deadliest assaults on American forces in Afghanistan, a battle that came to symbolize the war itself.

item.title: How America Turned Allies into Enemies in Afghanistan
item.description: The United States killed its own allies, sabotaging itself in a part of Afghanistan where it never needed to be.

item.title: Ontario premier says energy supplies to the US will be cut off if Trump imposes tariffs on Canada
item.description: “We will use every tool in our tool box to fight back," says Ontario Premier Doug Ford.

item.title: How America Turned Allies into Enemies in Afghanistan
item.description: The United States killed its own allies, sabotaging itself in a part of Afghanistan where it never needed to be.

item.title: F.B.I. Chief to Step Out of ‘the Fray,’ and Housing’s Terrible Year
item.description: Plus, a labor fight that could upend reality TV.

item.title: Young Koreans, Seeing Democracy at Stake, Take to the Streets
item.description: South Korea’s night of martial law was a jolt for some members of a generation accused of political apathy. They say they aren’t going away.

item.title: Young Koreans, Seeing Democracy at Stake, Take to the Streets
item.description: South Korea’s night of martial law was a jolt for some members of a generation accused of political apathy. They say they aren’t going away.

item.title: Biden Is Pardoning Nearly 1,500 Americans, a Record for a U.S. President
item.description: Many of those being granted clemency had been placed in home confinement during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Revenge and Unease Shadow Effort to Restore Order
item.description: The rebel leader who helped oust the Assad regime called on countries to hand over “criminals” who fled Syria. A top Kurdish commander criticized the ...

item.description: Many of those being granted clemency had been placed in home confinement during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Biden administration will hike tariffs on imports of Chinese solar wafers, polysilicon and tungsten products
item.description: “The tariff increases announced today will further blunt the harmful policies and practices by the People’s Republic of China," USTR Katharine Tai sai...
